column4: Hello. I upgraded from 11.04 to 11.10 yesterday and I can not login anymore. At the login screen, I enter my login/Pass, the screen becomes black and... return to the login screen. (when my password is wrong it jsut says it to me)
I can not log my user account but I can log with the "guest" one
what happens when you try to log in?
how much free space does the system have?
: When I try to log with my account : the password is "validated" and the screen becomes black. Then after 1 seconde the login screen appears again.
how much free space do you have?
what is the command line to see that ? (because I can log with the CTRL+ALT+F1)
ok that's fine. ok, run:  sudo chown $USER:$USER $HOME     I assume you are logged in as the troublesome user
thats fine, ok try and log in
does not work. Only the Guest Session can log in, my user session is just accessible in console mode. Maybe a gnome/driver/... conflict ?
Login sucessfull, with a savage method : I moved all my ~/.* directories in a backup directory
i see,I guess if it works :)
